page.title: 17TREFLYS CHURCH MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: St.Michael & All Angels,Treflys,is a daughter church of St.Catherine, Criccieth,of the Diocese of Bangor. One service,said in English on Sundays by the Ven.Archdeacon of Merioneth, rector of Criccieth,is attended by about 18 communicants,increasing during festivals and holiday times. The church consists of a knave, possibly 14th century,and a modern chancel of 1888,replacing one poorly built at the same time as the nave, all signs of which have disappeared. The modern windows are possibly in the same positions as the old.The west doorway suggests 14th century and the plain pedimented bell-cote may also be original.The bell is inscribed "EXPEDITIO ME FUDIT:H BOHM:1743".
